intro: Phalaroides picta, commonly known as the painted sandflat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in coastal dunes and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are often pink or purple in color. Phalaroides picta is adapted to harsh coastal environments and plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes through its extensive root system.
